intro: Dipteracanthus subulatus, commonly known as the needleleaf dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
